title: Why am I permabanned?? Riot please respond

embed.description: Post with 2 views. Shared by scobism. evidence of way too harsh of a ban

replies.body:
You literally just got off your 14-day ban today, and you were told that further behavior of a similar nature would result in a perma ban.

Your first game after being unbanned, you started in with the same types of thing that got you banned. You didn't change your behavior, so the system took action.
{{summoner:11}} {{summoner:14}}

this game is pathetic im actually done, the 14 ban itself was already too much, should i upload that chat too, literally i played 2 games and went from 0 bans to permaban, riot you worry way to much about shit that doesn't matter but boosters, inters, and honestly kids who flame more are the problem, glad to see all you care about is money, ban everyone so they make new accounts, you say i just got off my 14 day when i literally got it from one game saying one word, %%%got, which i realise is homophobic and a slur, but to automatically permaban me is a joke, just like this company

Talk shit about 12-year-olds all you want, but if you feel the need to randomly call people homophobic slurs, you've clearly demonstrated that your own maturity level isn't much higher.

thats why i stopped, i didnt call anyone that did i, i literally said they are bronze and bad, im pretty sure this is a video game not a fucking job or school, didn't realise i had to be so MATURE to play a fucking game, you guys act so high and mighty like holy shit

Hey man, this thread was literally titled "Why was I permabanned riot please respond". Riot promptly responded to tell you why you were permabanned. 

And yet you rage. Like, what were you expecting?

Fact is, the community feels strongly against playing with people who have this kind of behavior; that's why you were banned so quickly.

As for it being just a game, I get that. But the game can last for up to an hour, where you can't feasibly leave an unpleasant experience such as the one you brought to the rift. That's why Riot takes action against toxic players.

With someone as toxic as yourself, no one wants to be around that kind of thing, so it is in the best interest of the community to remove you.

Welcome to being a adult almost everything you do needs to have some sort of maturity factor to it. Otherwise you wouldn't get anything done in life and end up living in mummies basement until your 50.

#BrokeBack

1. You're punished based off of what _you_ say and do; no one else. You're held accountable solely for your words and actions, when it comes to punishments and penalties.

2. Someone else being toxic does not give you a "free pass" to retaliate in kind -- ever. Two wrongs don't make a right, ever heard that saying? By insulting/harassing/verbally abusing others -- regardless of whether or not they are doing the same -- you are creating a negative and toxic environment, or escalating one that already exists.
